website_summaries.verdict: The Epson Perfection V850 Pro photo scanner offers professional-quality scanning for photographic prints and for film (positive or negative) at up to 8 by 10 inches.
pros: High-quality scans for photographic prints and film (including slides)
cons: Color-calibration software is frustratingly hard to use

customer_reviews.title: An excellent if expensive piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: An excellent if expensive piece of kit. For ordinary B & W photographs or document scanning buy one of the much cheaper Epson models - I could see no difference between this unit and one we have that was hundreds of pounds cheaper. However, if its slides or negatives you need to process, or colour prints, it really does shine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best flatbed scanner on the market. Excellent quality and easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Brightonbeat

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps the best flatbed for negs
customer_reviews.text: Does well for film scanning, perhaps the best you can find if you can't afford a dedicated film scanner. There are two software options: the dedicated HP program or the free offered Silverfast. People will tend to prefer one or the other, but a choice for which is best is not quite as simple as might seem. I've found that the best result program choice varies from film to film. It's probably OK to use the auto dust/scratch removal with either program, but leave stuff like colour balance and unsharp mask sharpening for export to your other non-scan programs.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hostick

customer_reviews.title: High quality equipment yields high quality scans
customer_reviews.text: I've only just begun. So far, this is just what I needed. Be forewarned, however, if you want to do serious scanning of a lot of photos, you'll won't to purchase additional software which is not cheap. Once I got start, I used this to scan in old, small photos...family heirlooms. The blowup nicely. It's tough to pick the right scanner for the job / budget. I'm comfortable with this choice and am confident it will do an even better job as I learn more about its significant set of features.
customer_reviews.author: inOZ

customer_reviews.title: Great for large-scale slide/photo digitisation projects
customer_reviews.text: The one con straight off: the trays for the slides are a little fiddly but otherwise they work fine. Scanner does an admirable job of letting you work through mountains of slides and photos relatively quickly. Word of advice: the Epson default scanning software included does a much better job that the other freebie that's included alongside. I'd just install the Epson software. Rarely been disappointed by Epson, glad this is still the case.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: The scanner itself feels cheap, the front fascia feels like it can be pulled off really easily. The power button is mushy and needs to be held for a second or 2, its difficult to know if the unit has been turned on or off successfully, the activity light is under a lip, so if you're scanning multiple photos it's not always easy to tell if the scanner has finished it's current job. However, the scanned results are very very good. I would recommend this but I wish that it wasn't made by Epson, I wish Apple had designed it as the build quality for such an expensive product isn't what I have come to expect.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ward

customer_reviews.title: Lack of useful information in manual had me wodering how to get ...
customer_reviews.text: Had difficulty in joining multi pin cable at rear of unit, pins seemed to be out of line, thus took me half an hour to get them to marry up to female end! Lack of useful information in manual had me wodering how to get the unit to scan negatives and tranparencies. Good old YouTube came to my aid, many useful films to watch. Having learnt how to use the V800 I am pleased with the end result. Many options to choose to get the right image via either Epson software or Silverlight SE8. Disappointed of the lack of spare 35mm neg and transparency holder available for the V800. Still searching the web for some.
customer_reviews.author: Severnbore

customer_reviews.title: very good. My negatives (small
customer_reviews.text: From what I have seen so far (I have only played with it for a day or so), this scanner is very, very good. My negatives (small, medium and large format) are mostly B&W so I can't comment on the colour fidelity, but the free Silverfast software provides comprehensive tools to ensure accurate colour rendering. One minor gripe: the quick setup guide is pretty useless, and omits a vital piece of information, viz. that the scanner is shipped with a mechanical lock (a plastic slider). It objects loudly if you try to turn it on with this in place!
customer_reviews.author: CJC

customer_reviews.title: Good quality scanner
customer_reviews.text: Grate quality, not overly fast and the lift up top is quite heavy due to being able to scan films, negatives and slides. Hoping this heavy lid wont cause problems in the future for example the friction hinges becoming loose and lid falling down unless held. Having said this looks well made and is working fine at present.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a project scanning 1, 000's of 35mm ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a project scanning 1,000's of 35mm and 6 x 6 medium format negatives. A very robust machine that delivers high quality scans. Slight quibble would be that at higher resolutions, the scanning speed is a little slow. That said I don't think there are faster machines in this segment of the Scanner market.
customer_reviews.author: J. Small

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal scanner
customer_reviews.text: This is not a technical review. The quality of the scans on this machine are phenomenal. It's a lot of money but if you want a top quality scanner this is it. I would pay this sort of money for a lens so why not a scanner, absolutely delighted with it.
customer_reviews.author: F Page

customer_reviews.title: Good for medium and large format
customer_reviews.text: Good for medium and large format, looks like the real world resolution is nearer 2,500dpi so 35mm scans look a bit ropey still. Not the end of the world as I have a dedicated Nikon 35mm scanner for that so this fits in with my need for decent medium and large format film scans.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product...
customer_reviews.text: I decided after 11 years to upgrade from my original Epson V750 Pro to the V850 Pro. I was not disappointed. Not a major upgrade but with faster power-up and marginal improvement in scan quality, I figured it was worth the investment. I have not been disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: DRTphotos

customer_reviews.title: EPSON PERFECTION  SAYS IT ALL
customer_reviews.text: I love this scanner iv had a few scanners and must say this is the best I ever had It may have a hefty price but when you use it you can see where your money is the quality of the pictures I print from the scans are that good you cant tell they are scans I WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.author: DALE

customer_reviews.title: Best scanner for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality product which delivers pro results. But you have to put in the time to get to really know it. If you do this, it won't disappoint you. I have used it for image scanning as well as scanning of glass negatives - both with great results.
customer_reviews.author: DVG

customer_reviews.title: It's not called PERFECTION for nothing!
customer_reviews.text: General purpose scanning of all documents leaves nothing to be desired and the film scanning attachment(s) especially for 35mm strip gives the best focus/grey scale and lack of unwanted artifacts of any scanner I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: AudioPete

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Once you get it fully installed and get your head around the jargon you'll never be second rated
customer_reviews.author: Satch

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WORKHORSE
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and scans brilliantly. I don't use the Epson software, instead I use Vuescan and have more options available than through using 'Epson Scan' and there are regular updates. Great scanner I'd recommend it for anyone who prints photographs - that's what it's meant for and it does it superbly.
customer_reviews.author: Soulmansblue

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I have used Epson scanners and software before which was straightforward This Software is poor and not intuitive. Both Silverfast and Epsons own. After several updates it is now working but should have been a lot easier. Still can’t get the Epson software to operate correctly so just using Silverfast.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Ideal upgrade for Large Format Film scanning.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily for scanning large format film. I have used the V500 for a number of years for Medium format which made the transition easy as the Pro scanning interface is the same. I have only used it a couple of times but don't anticipate any problems as I am experienced and comfortable with the Epson software. Fast operation and good results.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. J. Down

customer_reviews.title: Good all round scanner
customer_reviews.text: A very good scanner - prefer Epson's software to bundled Silverfast software - still testing but it's looking good. Scanner can also work in the background whilst I do other things.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Taylor

customer_reviews.title: A great scanner for copying film, slides and prints as well as documents.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent scanner that I bought to scan 35mm slides. The slide holder holds 12 slides and the software is easy to use. The results are better than anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Epson Perfection V800 Scanner
customer_reviews.text: great scanner does all that I expect from it.as it does up to 12 slides at a time
customer_reviews.author: M. W. Gilliam

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise I am very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to work this out but once connected to my Apple Mac it did require me to familiarize the terminology used in the software before I got the desired results! Otherwise I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Check the drivers rosin get it wrong if you are using a mac
customer_reviews.text: Did not give 5stars because the downloads for Mac did not have the correct drivers. Had to search internet for solution. epsons help desk was useless. Once loaded the scanner performed extremely well with the silver fat software privided
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfection it is !
customer_reviews.text: just a super machine , wasted on my limited talents but the machine is faultless and scans superb.. highly recommended..
customer_reviews.author: C. R. Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: A great bit of Kit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. will do more than you think and is a really cleaver piece of gear and really good value compared with amny others.
customer_reviews.author: P B

customer_reviews.title: Quality results from negs and trannies!
customer_reviews.text: I'd recommend it to anyone to get the best out their analogue film (as I'm doing with my archive). The bundled various size film holder's are proving very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Number 6

customer_reviews.title: Really good scanner
customer_reviews.text: Using it for digitizing old photos is very speedy with excellent picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Johan

customer_reviews.title: Faulty.
customer_reviews.text: Oops, mine didn't work and it had to go back. The scans had a multicoloured line top to bottom, apparently not a rare fault. Otherwise the only scan of a120 negative Iooked OK, not great just ok.
customer_reviews.author: Graeme Tregay

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: A superb scanner expensive but if you want a quality machine worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: tomosino

customer_reviews.title: Feedback
customer_reviews.text: Great results so far; probably, with a bit of tuition I could do better which is my objective over time.
customer_reviews.author: Frampton

customer_reviews.title: superb
customer_reviews.text: A++ superb product and very fast shipping, very impressed - thank you so much
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A.

customer_reviews.title: was(and still is) very good. This is even better
customer_reviews.text: My previous Epson, the Perfection 4990 Photo, was(and still is) very good. This is even better, in particular because of the very quick warm-up time
customer_reviews.author: C.Watson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scanner
customer_reviews.text: A brilliant scanner producing excellent results and fairly easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: mr k c williamson

customer_reviews.title: Hardly a cheap or budget option, but it does ...
customer_reviews.text: Hardly a cheap or budget option, but it does exactly what it claims to do. A huge asset for digitising all our family records and photos for future reference.
customer_reviews.author: S. G. THOMAS

customer_reviews.title: simply glorious. Using for digitising old family pictures which ...
customer_reviews.text: simply glorious. Using for digitising old family pictures which are starting to deteriorate.
customer_reviews.author: RichardL

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Capture all from < 35mm to 10 x 8. Excellent image and build quality.
customer_reviews.author: 33 1/3 Speed King

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: An excellent scanner that's let down by a badly designed medium format film holder.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Watts

customer_reviews.title: he is very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my son, he is very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Khosrow Elm

customer_reviews.title: very easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play, very easy set up, no fuss at all and great results.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Smith

customer_reviews.title: works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: Well packaged, arrived on time, works like a dream, perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Block

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product no problems so far and done a lot of scanning all on automatic settings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY SATISFIED CUSTOMER
customer_reviews.text: Still learning some of the "tricks of the trade" have yet to install Silverline software as the present Epson kit works very well, have done close on 1000 scans since purchase xmas 2014 and more or less 99% satisfied, this is my third Epson scanner and the best by far. Slides scanning is good, close to Nikon Coolscan quality but they are no longer supported with software updates. The Nikon store in NY, B & H recommended his model last year and I am still learning its best features. If you scan negatives make sure you purchase an air canister to clean the scanner desk/neg holders and the negs themselves first! A lot of dust not visible to the eye.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. B. Parker

customer_reviews.title: I really would like to purchase this product without optical faults
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scanner and whilst inspecting the unit I noticed particles on the inside of the scanner glass face it also had a scratch and a smudges not impressed at all. So as I wanted this scanner I sent it back and got a replacement from Amazon. Guess what the second unit had similar problems with dust and marks that are visible when shining a torch into the unit , Epson Uk said that I should try the unit and see if the defects were visible so I did and yes they were so I sent this one back as well. I really would like to purchase this product without optical faults.
customer_reviews.author: WALKES1

customer_reviews.title: Out of the box and back in again for a refund !
customer_reviews.text: Could not get the damn thing to work. Spent loads of time on it. Looked up everything I could but still the flashing red light. Sent it back and ordered a CANON which after 20 mins was producing what I wanted. No more Epson products for me!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Honestly, I should have ordered 3 Black inks, ...
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I should have ordered 3 Black inks, and a (negative) cleaning brush. I shall place the order next time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not For Me
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply could not get the scanner to work. The images were not focussed and I could not get any decent scans. Admitedlly I'm not particularly gifted when it comes to figuring out tech stuff. Persevered for a week trying various techniques without success I eventually returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Tennisartist

product_meta.title: Epson Perfection V850 Pro A4 Flatbed Scanner with ReadyScan LED Technology - 6400 x 9600 dpi
product_meta.description:
Size Name:V850

Featuring enhanced high-pass optics that deliver the highest level of image quality with faster scan speeds, the V850 Pro can convert a wide range of media and film formats into professional-quality digital images.

This high-productivity 6400dpi scanner requires virtually no warm-up time, can remove dust and scratches automatically, and includes two sets of high-quality film holders.

Choice of resolution:

The V850 Pro features a dual lens system that automatically selects the optimal lens, with up to 4800dpi optical resolution for photo scanning and 6400dpi when scanning using film holders.

Scan from any source:

Scan a range of film formats in sharp focus thanks to the improved quality film holders with their adjustable height control and rigid design.

The V850 Pro also supports film formats up to 8x10 inch when placed directly on the scanner glass.

High productivity:

Epson's ReadyScan LED light source has a warm up time of less than one second, so scanning can start almost instantly.

Two sets of film holders mean you can prepare a second set of originals for scanning while the first is still scanning.

Cleans-up images:

Digital Image Correction and Enhancement (ICE) Technologies automatically removes imperfections such as dust, hair, scratches and fingerprints from both film and photos to restore images to their former glory with the minimum of effort.

The right tone:

Take advantage of excellent tone reproduction with 4.0 DMax optical density. The V850 Pro can detect the exact tonal range of the original, making sure the brightest and darkest areas of images are accurately reproduced to reveal impressive detail and dynamic range.

Professional software:

As well as Epson Scan, the V850 Pro comes with SilverFast SE Plus 8 and i1 Scanner software for advanced, professional scanning features.



BOX CONTAINS
Epson Scanner
AC Aadapter
USB Cable
Film Holders
User Documentation/Media
feature_bullets: Professional quality scanning: Slides, film, medium format & prints
Dual lens system: Swaps between 6400dpi for slides and film, and 4800dpi for photos
High productivity: One second warm up time and two sets of film holders
Dynamic range: Accurately reproduce tonal range and gradation of the original
Removes imperfections: DIGITAL ICE (Image Correction and Enhancement)Technologies clean up old film and photos

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars109 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
